newsitem.title: FRANCE: Suez refuses to confirm 96 profit forecast.
newsitem.headline: Suez refuses to confirm 96 profit forecast.

text.p: French holding Compagnie de Suez chairman Gerard Mestrallet on Wednesday refused to confirm an earlier net profit forecast for the full-year 1996 period.

"In conformity with a policy I adopted at Generale de Belgique, I will only speak of the pre-tax, pre-exceptional profit, which will in 1996 show growth compared to the previous year, once again on a like-for-like basis," he told reporters at a news conference called to announce half-year results.
Mestrallet was chairman of Suez affiliate Societe Generale de Belgique before taking over at Suez.
"I hope so," Mestrallet said when pressed about whether Suez would post a net profit for the year.
Suez reported earlier on Wednesday a net profit of 772 million francs for the first half of 1996, compared with a 3.98 billion franc loss in the first half of 1995.
On June 12, Mestrallet told shareholders at an annual meeting that the company would return to profit in 1996 after large losses in 1995.
"I confirm that Suez will return to profit in 1996," he said at the time.
